title: Brochure, "Yale Summer School Program, Switzerland, 1988", 1988
signed: Imprinted in red ink, lower page, lower right corner: Design Paul Rand
inscribed: Imprinted in black ink, lower 1/3 of upper page (alternating tabbed and not): Yale Summer Program/ Graphic Design/ Brissago, Switzerland/ 18 June-25 July 1988; imprinted in red ink, lower page, from upper left corner to lower right corner: Program:/ The intensive five-week residential program provides/ a structured curriculum of theoretical studies and/ practical exercises dealing with various aspects of/ graphic design. ... Yale University affirmatively seeks to attract to/ its faculty, staff and student body qualified persons of/ diverse backgrounds and pursuant to this policy,/ Yale does not discriminate in admissions, educational/ programs or employment against any individual on/ account of that individual's sex, race, color, religion, age,/ handicap, or national or ethnic origin; nor does/ Yale discriminate on the basis of sexual orientation.
dimensions:
60.8 x 20.3 cm (24 x 8 in. )-opened
30.4 x 20.3 cm (11 5/6 x 8 in.)-closed
description: Off-white brochure, opens vertically.  Closed: recto and verso, blank. Opened:  upper 2/3 of upper page, vertical design, red square with white cross in center (Swiss flag) and black Y (Yale) inside square. Beneath design, lower 1/3 of page, big black lettering describing name, place, and dates of program. Lower page, 2 columns of text in red ink, describing the program, location, administration, faculty, visiting faculty, credit, eligibility, cost, admission, and financial aid.  Left column, space between location and administration, photograph of black and white bull dog.
